page.title: 04BEECHWOOD PARK SCHOOL
page.content: It was originally an H-shaped Tudor house,built in 1540 by R.Page.From 1628 the Saunders family occupied it. Anna Saunders married Sir Edward Sebright and later Sir Thomas altered it in 1860.In world war 2 it was used as a repair station for fighter planes It now has 100 rooms, all classrooms or dormitories. Recently, a sports hall and a junior wing have been added.The school has a nature reserve, quite a large wood and extensive playing fields. There are 3 tennis courts, a swimming pool and a small golf course. There is an old ice-house which was used as a shelter in the war. The lovely Great Hall contains a powerful organ which was the most advanced electric one of its time when built. There are 300 boys, aged 4-13 in the school today, and about 6 girls!
